business.headline: US stocks plummet after China's retaliatory levies in response to Trump tariffsNasdaq IXIC dropped more than 20 per cent from its all-time closing high touched in December, putting it on course to confirm a bear market.

Know rules for marriage, education, home and medical needsIf you require money out of your EPF for the purposes of marriage or further studies, there are set regulations one needs to adhere to. Former diplomat Ashok Sajjanar criticises the non-transparent system and highlights the impact on strategic partnerships in the Indo-Pacific region.

Mixed bag, not a setback: India's first response to Trump's tariffThe Commerce Ministry of India is analysing the impact of the 27% tariff imposed by the US. The ministry states it's a mixed bag and not a setback. Exemptions are expected in sectors like pharmaceuticals, semiconductors, and critical minerals. The tariff ranges from 10% to 27% across various sectors. India aims to sign a Bilateral Trade Agreement with the US by fall this year.
